description: From Middle English besechen, bisechen, prefixed form of Old English sēċan (“to seek or inquire about”). Cognate with Saterland Frisian besäike (“to visit”), Dutch bezoeken (“to visit, attend, see”), German besuchen (“to visit, attend, see”), Swedish besöka (“to visit, go to see”).

verbs.description: beseech (third-person singular simple present beseeches, present participle beseeching, simple past and past participle beseeched or besought)

examples: after what manner, I beseech you, must the mind proceed in this operation?
[…] the tickets had all been given out, begged, besought long ago.
